description: Returns the full details of a channel flow in an Amazon Chime AppInstance. This is a developer API.

parameters.name: ChannelFlowArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the channel flow.

nested_items.name: ChannelFlowArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the channel flow.

nested_items.name: Processors
nested_items.description: Information about the processor Lambda functions.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the channel flow.

nested_items.name: Configuration
nested_items.description: The information about the type of processor and its identifier.

nested_items.name: ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda message processing function.

nested_items.name: InvocationType
nested_items.description: Controls how the Lambda function is invoked.

nested_items.name: ExecutionOrder
nested_items.description: The sequence in which processors run. If you have multiple processors in a channel flow, message processing goes through each processor in the sequence. The value determines the sequence. At this point, we support only 1 processor within a flow.

nested_items.name: FallbackAction
nested_items.description: Determines whether to continue with message processing or stop it in cases where communication with a processor fails. If a processor has a fallback action of ABORT and communication with it fails, the processor sets the message status to FAILED and does not send the message to any recipients. Note that if the last processor in the channel flow sequence has a fallback action of CONTINUE and communication with the processor fails, then the message is considered processed and sent to recipients of the channel.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the channel flow.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time at which the channel flow was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time at which a channel flow was updated.
